CatDescriptText: Mr. Joseph A. Dickerson, chemical operator, Coraopolis and Mrs. Anna Watson, factory worker, Neville Island, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 21, 1962, pg. 6 with question: Do you think the Government should investigate Big Steel's hiking the price of steel?" Mr. Joseph A. Dickerson's answer reads: "I think they should.  It will be pretty rough if they don't.  They want a raise now and then after getting a raise will raise the price later, and this will cause the cost of living to rise."  Mrs. Anna Watson's Answer reads: "I certainly do, because I think a hike in the price of steel is going to make it hard on everything, and put a lot of persons out of jobs..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Joseph A. Dickerson wearing eyeglasses and tweed overcoat with upturned collar, standing in front of Empire Building with Faber sign, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Anna Watson wearing dark head scarf and light colored overcoat, standing on sidewalk, woman holding umbrella in background, Downtown
